alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 9:33PM CST until January 08 at 2:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. .Rainfall from last night through this morning, combined with ice action may produce flooding on the Rock River near Joslin by mid week. At this time, there is still limited confidence in the extent of rain run-off and effects of Ice action will have on the river levels. Thus the watch will continue for now. As the forecast becomes more certain, this watch will either be upgraded to a flood warning or cancelled. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water affects low lying agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
